snippet: Officials are moving away from a theory that a white supremacist prison gang or Mexican drug cartels were responsible for killing two prosecutors eight weeks apart in Kaufman, Tex.
abstract: Law enforcement officials are exploring possibility that killings of prosecutor Mark E Hasse, and later district attorney Mike McLelland and his wife Cynthia in Kaufman, Tex, were work of a local person, or 'lone wolf', seeking revenge, rather than of a prison gang or drug cartel.

byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and SERGE F. KOVALESKI
byline.contributor: Lauren D’Avolio contributed reporting from Dallas, and Alain Delaquérière contributed research from New York.

lead_paragraph: Officials are moving away from a theory that a white supremacist prison gang or Mexican drug cartels were responsible for killing two prosecutors eight weeks apart in Kaufman, Tex.

headline.seo: Texas Prosecutors May Have Been Killed by ‘Lone Wolf’
headline.main: ‘Lone Wolf’ Theory Gains Ground in Texas Deaths
headline.print_headline: A ‘Lone Wolf’ Theory Gains Ground in Texas Prosecutors’ Deaths
